column4: Hey, I'm trying to install ubuntu on my family's screen, but trepare partitions step is blank
sounds like setup is failing to detect your hard disk(s) - what output do you get from "sudo fdisk -l" in terminal?
I get no output
then it's not detecting any drives - what OS was on the system before?
vista.  But they crashed it, which is why I'm installing ubuntu
what kind of computer is it?
as in, it doesn't even go to windows
hp
do you know what type of hard disk(s) are in the system? how old is it? are they SATA?
we got it last christmas.  I dont know how to find type of harddrive or whatever SATA is
you could open it up if you feel confident - what's your hardware and software experience like?
I am not confident at all.
I have no hardware experiences
when the computer boots, does it show any kinds of Vista related attempts at booting?
I don't think so...I'd have to check.  But I'm pretty sure not
I'll go on my laptop and turn off this computer.  I am sje46
ok, i am beginning to suspect more problems than just Vista creaming itself :)
as in, hardware problems?
yep
i'm just getting food now, feel free to PM me when you're back or something
i'll be here
alright
